chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

l: seq T

rev_reshape : forall (T : Type) (sh : seq nat) (s : seq T), size s = sumn sh -> rev (reshape sh s) = [seq rev i | i <- reshape (rev sh) (rev s)]
behead_rev : forall s : seq ?T, behead (rev s) = rev (belast s) where ?T : [T : Type l : seq T |- Type]
rev_flatten : forall (T : Type) (ss : seq (seq T)), rev (flatten ss) = flatten (rev [seq rev i | i <- ss])
shape_rev : forall (T : Type) (ss : seq (seq T)), shape (rev ss) = rev (shape ss)
rev_rotr : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (s : seq T), rev (rotr n0 s) = rot n0 (rev s)
rev_rot : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (s : seq T), rev (rot n0 s) = rotr n0 (rev s)
rev_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rev (x :: s) = rcons (rev s) x
drop_rev : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (s : seq T), drop n0 (rev s) = rev (take (ssrnat.subn (size s) n0) s)
take_rev : forall (n0 : nat) (T : Type) (s : seq T), take n0 (rev s) = rev (drop (ssrnat.subn (size s) n0) s)
rev_cat : forall (T : Type) (s t : seq T), rev (s ++ t) = rev t ++ rev s
rev_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), rev (rcons s x) = x :: rev s

List.firstn_all : forall (A : Type) (l : seq A), List.firstn (length l) l = l
sumn_rev : forall s : seq nat, sumn (rev s) = sumn s
filter_rev : forall (T : Type) (a : pred T) (s : seq T), [seq x <- rev s | a x] = rev [seq x <- s | a x]
map_rev : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rev s] = rev [seq f i | i <- s]
size_rev : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T), size (rev s) = size s

has_rev : forall (T : Type) (a : pred T) (s : seq T), has a (rev s) = has a s
all_rev : forall (T : Type) (a : pred T) (s : seq T), all a (rev s) = all a s
count_rev : forall (T : Type) (a : pred T) (s : seq T), count a (rev s) = count a s

catrev = fun T : Type => fix catrev (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => catrev s1' (x :: s2) end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope seq_scope]
cat = fun T : Type => fix cat (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => x :: cat s1' s2 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope seq_scope]
List.map_ext_in_iff : List.map ?f ?l = List.map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, List.In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [T : Type l : seq T |- Type] ?B : [T : Type l : seq T |- Type] ?f : [T : Type l : seq T |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [T : Type l : seq T |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [T : Type l : seq T |- seq ?A]
mem_rev : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), rev s =i s
shape = fun T : Type => map size : forall T : Type, seq (seq T) -> seq nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]

seq.belast = fun T : Type => fix belast (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [::] | x' :: s' => x :: belast x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
rot = fun (T : Type) (n : nat) (s : seq T) => drop n s ++ take n s : forall T : Type, nat -> seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope seq_scope]
rcons = fun T : Type => fix rcons (s : seq T) (z : T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [:: z] | x :: s' => x :: rcons s' z end : forall T : Type, seq T -> T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope _]

behead = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | _ :: s' => s' end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
